try not to worry what other people are

Yeah! I struggle with that a lot. So I like

into a certain situation. And my secret

This is big. The thing you

always have in common with the other
person is you and that other person are

at the same place at the same time. And
you can always talk about that. Ask a

person about themselves, start with an
open-ended question and you always have

the thing you're both there for in
common.
Tip number four: if you say sorry

constantly it can make you and it the
person you're apologising to feel worse.

Try replacing half of those sorrys with

It's really hard to change this. A big tip I have in general for

people who do something often and have
struggled to change it is come to terms

with it and express that to people to
say, "oh I'm sorry did that! Gosh I'm

sorry I said sorry I didn't get like I
just say I'm sorry a lot this is just
one of my things!" Coming coming to terms with the weird things that you do –

because we all do weird things – I do
super weird things – can be healing

and if you share that with other people
it can sort of deflate the tension there.

So I'm gonna say...

change.

Tip number five: when you're expressing
gratitude, saying thank you, use language

that praises others instead of focusing
on yourself. So for example: Thank You

Ali for giving your time and expertise
to this video, rather than: thanks for
making this really easy for me!
Yes yes is I love this tip I'm

giving this a five out of five!
Gratitude in the form of labelled

specific praise – super important – so not
thank you, but thank you for specific
reason. Now! Here it comes...
praise can be difficult to

expressing gratitude this way is knowing

something you can have a conversation
with that person.
